meanings.definition: The occurrence of the same letter or sound at the beginning of adjacent or closely connected words.
meanings.sent1: Alliteration adds a fun flair to writing.
meanings.sent2: The poet used alliteration to make the verse more melodic.
meanings.sent3: The tongue twister was full of playful alliteration.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like a symphony of alliteration.
meanings.sent5: The alliteration in the sentence made it easy to remember.

meanings.definition: The repetition of consonant sounds, especially at the beginning of words.
meanings.sent1: Alliteration can create a catchy rhythm in poetry.
meanings.sent2: The author's use of alliteration made the passage more memorable.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke relied on clever alliteration.
meanings.sent4: The alliteration in the song lyrics painted a vivid picture.
meanings.sent5: The alliteration emphasized the mood of the story.
